_prev_prog_3.Description:
Hattiesburg LPG Storage Facility 

The Hattiesburg LPG Storage Facility participates in an Environmental, Health & Safety Management System (EHSMS) which delineates the responsibilities of each team member to help prevent major incidents and protect human health and the environment.  The terminal superintendent has the overall responsibility for ensuring that the facility operates in a safe and reliable manner. However, all personnel ensure that safe work practices, equipment design specifications, and maintenance schedules are adhered to thereby reducing the probability of an incident at the facility.  Hattiesburg LPG Storage Facility has programs to comply with all environment, health, and safety laws. The facility takes a systematic, proactive approach to preventing accidental releases. The process management systems address each of the essential features of successful accidental prevention programs including:

- Process safety information 

- Pre-startup review

- Process hazard analysis 

- Compliance audits

- Operating procedures 

- Incident investigation

-Training 

- Employee participation

- Mechanical integrity 

- Hot work permits

- Management of change 

- Contractor Safety

Hattiesburg LPG Storage Facility's risk management program uses these individual elements to prevent accidental chemical releases.  The facility employs extensive mechanical integrity and preventive maintenance programs to ensure the integrity of the equipment and safety systems. The mechanical integrity program uses surveillance equipment and preventive maintenance activities to identify equipment that may need attention before failure occurs. This program also specifies the needed action or repair to return equipment to proper operating conditions.  Hattiesburg LPG Storage Facility's employees are trained to safely perform their assigned tasks. The training program includes initial training as well as periodic refresher training and training updates when major processes or equipment is changed.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accident Prevention and Response Policies



Energy Transfer Hattiesburg NGLs LLC, in Petal, Mississippi is a liquified petroleum gas (LPG)storage facility.  The LPG stored is butane.  The facility utilizes certain safety precautions to prevent unnecessary on-site human exposure and to minimize the potential for any offsite exposure.  These safety precautions include: 

 1. Effectively managing our process operations; 

 2. Investing in the latest process safety technologies; 

    training and retraining our personnel; 

 3. Reviewing our processes for hazards on a continuous basis; 

 4. Ensuring safety is considered in process design, installation, operations and 

    maintenance.  



The facility maintains a policy to be a good business partner; a safe and conscientious neighbor; and to operate in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.





Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances



The Energy Transfer Hattiesburg NGLs LLC facility contains the RMP regulated flammable substance of  butane.  The maximum intended inventory assumes twenty two (22) rail cars are loaded and detached from their motive force, along with the five (5) large storage tanks.





The General Accident Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps



The Terminal Operations Manager has overall responsibility for ensuring that our facility operates in a safe and reliable manner.  However, all personnel ensure that safe work practices, equipment design specifications, and maintenance schedules are adhered to thereby reducing the probability of an accident at the facility.



Energy Transfer Hattiesburg NGLs LLC has developed programs to comply with all environmental, health, and safety laws.  Energy Transfer Hattiesburg NGLs LLC takes a systematic, proactive approach to preventing accidental releases.  Our risk management program addresses each of the essential features of successful accident prevention programs, including:

 1. Process

Safety Information

 2. Process Hazard Analysis

 3. Operating Procedures

 4. Training

 5. Mechanical Integrity

 6. Management of Change

 7. Pre-Startup Safety Review

 8. Compliance Audits

 9. Incident Investigation

 10.Employee Partcipation

 11.Hot Work Permits

 12.Contractor Safety





The Energy Transfer Hattiesburg NGLs LLC facility employs extensive mechanical integrity and preventative maintenance programs to ensure the integrity of the equipment and safety systems.  The mechanical integrity program uses equipment surveillance and preventative maintenance activities to identify equipment that may be deteriorating and in need of repair or replacement, before failure occurs.  This program also specifies the repairs and/or parts needed to return equipment to acceptable specifications.



The Energy Transfer Hattiesburg NGLs LLC facility trains facility employees to safely perform their assigned tasks.  The training program includes initial training as well as periodic refresher training and training updates when major process or equipment changes are made.





Five-Year Accident History



The Energy Transfer Hattiesburg NGLs LLC facility has not had any accidents that meet the criteria for the Five-Year Accident History.





Emergency Response Program



Energy Transfer Hattiesburg NGLs LLC is a member of the Petal Dome Mutual Aid (PDMA) group and the Forrest County LEPC.  The PDMA has an emergency response plan which details procedures for accidental releases and includes notification of the Forrest County LEPC and other local authorities.  We maintain an "open door" policy with local emergency response organizations to help ensure maximum understanding and cooperation during an emergency.





Planned Changes to Improve Safety



The Energy Transfer Hattiesburg NGLs LLC personnel continually strive to improve all aspects of our safety programs to protect our workers and the public.
